page.title: Indian Institute of Information Technology Una

revision.comment: [[WP:AES|←]]Created page with '<!-- Don't mess with this line! -->{{subst:unreviewed}} <!-- Write your article below this line --> Indian Institute of Information Technology Una (IIIT, Una) i...'
revision.text:
<!-- Don't mess with this line! -->{{New unreviewed article|date=January 2016}} <!-- Write your article below this line -->
Indian Institute of Information Technology Una (IIIT, Una) is one of the [[Indian Institutes of Information Technology]] located at Ranpur near [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]]. The academic session of IIIT Kota started from its temporary campus at [[National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur]] from year 2015. IIIT Una is a joint venture of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, the Govt. of Himachal Pardesh, with Industries in Public-Private Partnership model.<ref>[http://www.pagalguy.com/articles/expected-cutoffs-2015-iiit-una-32950447 Pagalguy IIIT una]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}} <!-- After listing your sources please cite them using inline citations and place them after the information they cite. Please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> * * * *
<!-- STOP! Be warned that by using this process instead of Articles for Creation, this article is subject to scrutiny. As an article in "mainspace", it will be DELETED if there are problems, not just declined. If you wish to use AfC, please return to the Wizard and continue from there. -->

revision.comment: /* its new iiit institute in india*/
revision.text:
<!-- Don't mess with this line! -->{{New unreviewed article|date=January 2016}} <!-- Write your article below this line -->
Indian Institute of Information Technology Una (IIIT, Una) is one of the [[Indian Institutes of Information Technology]] located at Ranpur near [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]]. The academic session of IIIT Kota started from its temporary campus at [[National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur]] from year 2015. IIIT Una is a joint venture of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, the Govt. of [[Himachal Pardesh]], with Industries in Public-Private Partnership model.<ref>[http://www.pagalguy.com/articles/expected-cutoffs-2015-iiit-una-32950447 Pagalguy IIIT una]</ref><ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/shimla/Himachal-CM-lays-foundation-stone-of-various-projects-in-Kangra-district/articleshow/50628580.cms Himachal CM lays foundation stone of various projects in Kangra district ]</ref><ref>[http://mhrd.gov.in/iiits IIITs in PPP mode]</ref>
==References== {{reflist}} <!-- After listing your sources please cite them using inline citations and place them after the information they cite. Please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> * * * *
<!-- STOP! Be warned that by using this process instead of Articles for Creation, this article is subject to scrutiny. As an article in "mainspace", it will be DELETED if there are problems, not just declined. If you wish to use AfC, please return to the Wizard and continue from there. -->

<!-- Don't mess with this line! -->{{New unreviewed article|date=January 2016}} <!-- Write your article below this line -->
Indian Institute of Information Technology Una (IIIT, Una) is one of the [[Indian Institutes of Information Technology]] located at Ranpur near [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]]. The academic session of IIIT Kota started from its temporary campus at [[National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur]] from year 2015. IIIT Una is a joint venture of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, the Govt. of [[Himachal Pardesh]], with Industries in Public-Private Partnership model.<ref>[http://www.pagalguy.com/articles/expected-cutoffs-2015-iiit-una-32950447 Pagalguy IIIT una]</ref><ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/shimla/Himachal-CM-lays-foundation-stone-of-various-projects-in-Kangra-district/articleshow/50628580.cms Himachal CM lays foundation stone of various projects in Kangra district ]</ref><ref name='pppIIIT'>[http://mhrd.gov.in/iiits IIITs in PPP mode]</ref>
==History== On 18 March 2013, [[Ministry of Human Resource Development]], [[Government of India]] introduced a bill in the Parliament to establish 20 new [[Indian Institute of Information Technology]]'s in different parts of the Country. As per the bill, MHRD will establish the 20 new IIITs under the Public Private Partnership (PPP) mode partnering with respective state governments and industry partners.<ref>[http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/newdelhi/bill-in-lok-sabha-to-establish-20-more-iiits/article1-1028288.aspx] IIIT Bill in Parliament</ref> The new IIITs are envisaged to be Institutes of National Importance. Aimed at generating highly competent manpower of global standards for the Information Technology Industry, the institutes are also expected to act as major catalyst to develop new knowledge in the field of Information Technology.<ref name='pppIIIT' />
Indian Institute of Information Technology – [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]] is amongst 20 new IIITs approved by MHRD.
==References== {{reflist}} <!-- After listing your sources please cite them using inline citations and place them after the information they cite. Please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> * * * *
<!-- STOP! Be warned that by using this process instead of Articles for Creation, this article is subject to scrutiny. As an article in "mainspace", it will be DELETED if there are problems, not just declined. If you wish to use AfC, please return to the Wizard and continue from there. -->

Indian Institute of Information Technology Una (IIIT, Una) is one of the [[Indian Institutes of Information Technology]] located at Ranpur near [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]]. The academic session of IIIT Kota started from its temporary campus at [[National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur]] from year 2015. IIIT Una is a joint venture of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, the Govt. of [[Himachal Pradesh]], with Industries in Public-Private Partnership model.<ref>[http://www.pagalguy.com/articles/expected-cutoffs-2015-iiit-una-32950447 Pagalguy IIIT una]</ref> <ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/shimla/Himachal-CM-lays-foundation-stone-of-various-projects-in-Kangra-district/articleshow/50628580.cms Himachal CM lays foundation stone of various projects in Kangra district]</ref><ref name='pppIIIT'>[http://mhrd.gov.in/iiits IIITs in PPP mode]</ref>
==History== On 18 March 2013, [[Ministry of Human Resource Development]], [[Government of India]] introduced a bill in the Parliament to establish 20 new [[Indian Institute of Information Technology]]'s in different parts of the Country. As per the bill, MHRD will establish the 20 new IIITs under the Public Private Partnership (PPP) mode partnering with respective state governments and industry partners.<ref>[http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/newdelhi/bill-in-lok-sabha-to-establish-20-more-iiits/article1-1028288.aspx NEW IIIT bill] IIIT Bill in Parliament</ref> The new IIITs are envisaged to be Institutes of National Importance. Aimed at generating highly competent manpower of global standards for the Information Technology Industry, the institutes are also expected to act as major catalyst to develop new knowledge in the field of Information Technology.<ref name='pppIIIT' />
Indian Institute of Information Technology – [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]] is amongst 20 new IIITs approved by MHRD and started to intake students from 2015.<ref>[http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/jee-main-2016/1/550415.html JEE MAIN 2016: List of participating institutes]</ref>

==History== On 18 March 2013, [[Ministry of Human Resource Development]], [[Government of India]] introduced a bill in the Parliament to establish 20 new [[Indian Institute of Information Technology]]'s in different parts of the Country. As per the bill, MHRD will establish the 20 new IIITs under the Public Private Partnership (PPP) mode partnering with respective state governments and industry partners.<ref>[http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/newdelhi/bill-in-lok-sabha-to-establish-20-more-iiits/article1-1028288.aspx NEW IIIT bill] IIIT Bill in Parliament</ref> The new IIITs are envisaged to be Institutes of National Importance. Aimed at generating highly competent manpower of global standards for the Information Technology Industry, the institutes are also expected to act as major catalyst to develop new knowledge in the field of Information Technology.<ref name='pppIIIT' />
Indian Institute of Information Technology – [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]] is amongst 20 new IIITs approved by MHRD and started to intake students from 2015.<ref>[http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/jee-main-2016/1/550415.html JEE MAIN 2016: List of participating institutes]</ref>
==Admissions== The admission to IIIT is through Central Seat allocation Board (CSAB). The students are allotted admission by CSAB based on their [[Joint Entrance Examination]] (JEE-Main) ranks. The Indian Institute of Information Technology, [[Sri City]], Chittoor District, Andhra Pradesh is listed in the CSAB website under List of participating institutes in Other Central Government / State Government Funded Technical Institutes.<ref>[https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B-6CYvPTv86XcUFuX0t4Z0hiWE0/edit?pli=1] Central Seat Allocation Board (CSAB) - 2013 - List of Participating Institutes.</ref>

Indian Institute of Information Technology Una (IIIT, Una) is one of the [[Indian Institutes of Information Technology]] located at Ranpur near [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]]. The academic session of IIIT Kota started from its temporary campus at [[National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur]] from year 2015. IIIT Una is a joint venture of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, the Govt. of [[Himachal Pradesh]], with Industries in Public-Private Partnership model.<ref>[http://www.pagalguy.com/articles/expected-cutoffs-2015-iiit-una-32950447 Pagalguy IIIT una]</ref> <ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/shimla/Himachal-CM-lays-foundation-stone-of-various-projects-in-Kangra-district/articleshow/50628580.cms Himachal CM lays foundation stone of various projects in Kangra district]</ref><ref name='pppIIIT'>[http://mhrd.gov.in/iiits IIITs in PPP mode]</ref>
==History== On 18 March 2013, [[Ministry of Human Resource Development]], [[Government of India]] introduced a bill in the Parliament to establish 20 new [[Indian Institute of Information Technology]]'s in different parts of the Country. As per the bill, MHRD will establish the 20 new IIITs under the Public Private Partnership (PPP) mode partnering with respective state governments and industry partners.<ref>[http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/newdelhi/bill-in-lok-sabha-to-establish-20-more-iiits/article1-1028288.aspx NEW IIIT bill] IIIT Bill in Parliament</ref> The new IIITs are envisaged to be Institutes of National Importance. Aimed at generating highly competent manpower of global standards for the Information Technology Industry, the institutes are also expected to act as major catalyst to develop new knowledge in the field of Information Technology.<ref name='pppIIIT' />
Indian Institute of Information Technology – [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]] is amongst 20 new IIITs approved by MHRD and started to intake students from 2015.<ref>[http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/jee-main-2016/1/550415.html JEE MAIN 2016: List of participating institutes]</ref>
==Admissions== The admission to IIIT is through Central Seat allocation Board (CSAB). The students are allotted admission by CSAB based on their [[Joint Entrance Examination]] (JEE-Main) ranks. The Indian Institute of Information Technology, [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]] is listed in the CSAB website under List of participating institutes in Other Central Government / State Government Funded Technical Institutes.<ref>[https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B-6CYvPTv86XcUFuX0t4Z0hiWE0/edit?pli=1] Central Seat Allocation Board (CSAB) - 2013 - List of Participating Institutes.</ref>
==References== {{reflist}} <!-- After listing your sources please cite them using inline citations and place them after the information they cite. Please see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wikipedia:REFB for instructions on how to add citations. --> * * * *

}}
Indian Institute of Information Technology Una (IIIT, Una) is one of the [[Indian Institutes of Information Technology]] located at Ranpur near [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]]. The academic session of IIIT Kota started from its temporary campus at [[National Institute of Technology, Hamirpur]] from year 2015. IIIT Una is a joint venture of the Ministry of Human Resource Development, Government of India, the Govt. of [[Himachal Pradesh]], with Industries in Public-Private Partnership model.<ref>[http://www.pagalguy.com/articles/expected-cutoffs-2015-iiit-una-32950447 Pagalguy IIIT una]</ref> <ref>[http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/shimla/Himachal-CM-lays-foundation-stone-of-various-projects-in-Kangra-district/articleshow/50628580.cms Himachal CM lays foundation stone of various projects in Kangra district]</ref><ref name='pppIIIT'>[http://mhrd.gov.in/iiits IIITs in PPP mode]</ref>
==History== On 18 March 2013, [[Ministry of Human Resource Development]], [[Government of India]] introduced a bill in the Parliament to establish 20 new [[Indian Institute of Information Technology]]'s in different parts of the Country. As per the bill, MHRD will establish the 20 new IIITs under the Public Private Partnership (PPP) mode partnering with respective state governments and industry partners.<ref>[http://www.hindustantimes.com/india-news/newdelhi/bill-in-lok-sabha-to-establish-20-more-iiits/article1-1028288.aspx NEW IIIT bill] IIIT Bill in Parliament</ref> The new IIITs are envisaged to be Institutes of National Importance. Aimed at generating highly competent manpower of global standards for the Information Technology Industry, the institutes are also expected to act as major catalyst to develop new knowledge in the field of Information Technology.<ref name='pppIIIT' />
Indian Institute of Information Technology – [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]] is amongst 20 new IIITs approved by MHRD and started to intake students from 2015.<ref name='jee2016'>[http://indiatoday.intoday.in/education/story/jee-main-2016/1/550415.html JEE MAIN 2016: List of participating institutes]</ref>
==Admissions== The admission to IIIT is through Central Seat allocation Board (CSAB). The students are allotted admission by CSAB based on their [[Joint Entrance Examination]] (JEE-Main) ranks. The Indian Institute of Information Technology, [[Una, Himachal Pradesh]] is listed in the CSAB website under List of participating institutes in Other Central Government / State Government Funded Technical Institutes.<ref name='jee2016' />
==Academic Programs== The Institute presently offers [[B.Tech]] in Computer Science and Engineering (CSE) and B.Tech in Electronics and Communication Engineering (ECE).

revision.comment: Changed the year of establishment of the institute to 2014 instead of 2015. Backed it up using links to cutoff of year 2014.
Reverting possible vandalism by [[Special:Contribs/117.207.147.218|117.207.147.218]] to version by Yobot. [[WP:CBFP|Report False Positive?]] Thanks, [[WP:CBNG|ClueBot NG]]. (2717901) (Bot)
Reverted 1 edit by [[Special:Contributions/Tigerson1995|Tigerson1995]] ([[User talk:Tigerson1995|talk]]) to last revision by ClueBot NG. ([[WP:TW|TW]])
/* top */clean up, [[WP:AWB/T|typo(s) fixed]]: Institue → Institute using [[Project:AWB|AWB]]
Rescuing 1 sources and tagging 0 as dead. #IABot (v1.3beta4)
added [[Category:Engineering colleges in Himachal Pradesh]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
new key for [[Category:Indian Institutes of Information Technology]]: "Una" using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
Add info on the private/industrial partners and links to the companies. Also add citation for source
/* History */ added the info about Narendra Modi laying foundation stone of the IIIT
removed [[Category:Una district]]; added [[Category:Education in Una district]] using [[WP:HC|HotCat]]
Future admissions will take place in IIIT Una campus, not NIT Hamirpur
